oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Wild Rose Interview - Biff Collie - Tape 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Tape 2 of 2. Recording of an interview with Wild Rose (performance group) conducted by Biff Collie.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Wild Rose; Biff Collie
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Wild Rose members describe why they chose "Breaking New Ground" to be the title track; Nancy Given jokes how "Breaking New Ground" caused trouble with her husband -- (01:13) Given gives praise to Carl Jackson -- (01:44) "I Can't Lose What I Never Had" writer Jim Rushing is reflected on by the Wild Rose members -- (02:58) "Go Down Swingin'" is described as a fun song, and the process of choosing songs for an album is discussed -- (03:37) Collie has the members of Wild Rose introduce themselves -- (04:59) Pamela Gadd describes growing up in Hammansburg, Ohio -- (05:38) "Where Did We Go Wrong" is joked about being a 'happy song' -- (05:58) Kathy Mac describes how she got her stage name -- (07:03) "Lonesome Highway (To the End of the Rainbow)" is described as a song about perusing from your dreams -- (07:31) Given describes how "On the Bayou" is known in the group under a different name; the Wild Rose band members joke about Louisiana -- (08:28) Collie has Pam Gadd joke, about knowing herself, while describing "Home Sweet Highway" -- (10:14) Gadd touches on how "Home Sweet Highway" is a tribute to those who had helped them; the Wild Rose members describe a incident with their Bus getting stuck -- (11:56) Collie has the Wild Rose band members touch on how they had changed bus drivers and the change in their careers -- (13:55) Pam Perry reveals that "Teach Me to Say Goodbye" is a tribute to her mother -- (15:47) "Who Needs You" is described as a negative song about people who will not change -- (18:07) Collie and the Wild Rose band members joke about Wanda Vick's background -- (19:58) "Easy to Say/Hard to Prove" is discussed, and the Wild Rose band members discuss their relationship with Beth Nielsen Chapman -- (21:08) Collie has the Wild Rose members reflect on the instances where songs are introduced near the end of the album cutting process; Gadd describes radio's influence on Wild Rose's success -- (23:08) Gadd remembers a time when she was encouraged to pursue music by her father; additionally, Gadd recalls how she discovered her comfort on stage -- (25:43) "Wild Rose" and the banjo are joked about by the Wild Rose band members -- (26:13) Wild Rose and Biff Collie say their thanks and goodbyes
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Wild Rose (Musical group); Collie, Biff;
